species.tip: Very common throughout the park.  Most are at least somewhat habituated to people and so don't scare easily.
Large rat snakes can sometimes be seen sunning themselves on the trails.
Quite common—listen for the distinctive 'churrr' call and drumming.
Present but rarely seen.  At night you can sometimes hear the coyotes howling.
Frequently seen on large sunny rocks on the shore of Rock Creek. Will jump into the water and swim away if frightened.
Striking woodpecker that can be seen fairly regularly flashing through the treetops.  Often calls while flying.
Most often seen on the ground foraging for ants on the border of forests and fields.
Can be seen on logs or boulders in the creek.
Frequently the source of rustling leaves, though hard to actually see.
Quite common near the creak just south of the zoo.  There is a large colony of wild Night-Herons in the zoo located (ironically) above the aviary.
